intro: Tetracmidion bucharicum, commonly known as the Bukharan sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Its roots are deep and fibrous, allowing it to thrive in sandy soils. The flowers are small and white, often clustered together, contributing to its ornamental value in dry landscapes.
